definition: (literary) screen wall shielding an entrance in traditional Chinese architecture
surname Xiao
miserable/desolate/dreary/Chinese mugwort
wall/CL:面[mian4],堵[du3]
variant of 牆|墙[qiang2], wall

sentences.english: Nobody wants to damage the walls or split the house.
sentences.chinese: 谁也不想祸起萧墙，自挖墙脚。

definition: imperial ancestral temple/imperial court/temple
internecine strife (idiom); fighting among oneself
to collapse/to topple/to capsize
foreign aggression
palace
fire beacon (used as alarm signal over long distance)
border fort, esp. defending narrow valley
female chicken crows at daybreak (idiom); a woman usurps authority/women meddle in politics/The female wears the trousers.
to destroy one's family
to deteriorate/to decline/to slump/also written 陵夷
Imperial City, inner part of Beijing, with the Forbidden City at its center
in danger of collapse/in a parlous state/(of person) treacherous
smoke signal indicating the presence of hostile forces
fire beacons on all sides (idiom); enveloped in the flames of war

a fire in the city gates is also a calamity for the fish in the moat (idiom); the bystander will also suffer/fig. you can't escape responsibility for your actions/ask not for whom the bell tolls - it tolls for thee
pinyin: cheng2 men2 shi1 huo3 , yang1 ji2 chi2 yu2

definition: burning beanstalks to cook the beans (idiom); to cause internecine strife
